i5.las2peer.security

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • i5.las2peer.security.Context
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AgentStorage

    public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgentStorage
    Each L2pThread is bound to a context, which is mainly determined by the executing agent.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Context(Node localNode, Agent mainAgent)
      Creates a new (local) context.
      Context(Node localNode, Agent mainAgent, java.lang.Object remoteNodeReference)
      Creates a new (remote) context.

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal()
        Refers this context to a local executing agent or a remote one?
        Returns:
        true, if the request is started locally and not via the P2P network

      • getAgent

        public Agent getAgent(long id)
               throws AgentNotKnownException
        Uses this context as AgentStorage. Returns agents that are unlocked in this context first. E.g. necessary for opening a received Message.
        Specified by:
        getAgent in interface AgentStorage
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        get the agent of the given id
        Throws:
        AgentNotKnownException

      • hasAgent

        public boolean hasAgent(long id)
        Description copied from interface: AgentStorage
        does this storage know the requested agent? Does not refer to the backup storage if applicable
        Specified by:
        hasAgent in interface AgentStorage
        Returns:
        true, if this storage knows an agent of the given id

      • getCurrent

        public static Context getCurrent()
        Gets the current LAS2peer context.
        Returns:
        the current context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - called not in a LAS2peer execution thread

      • logMessage

        public static void logMessage(java.lang.Object from,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Logs a message to the l2p system using the observers. Since this method will/should only be used in an L2pThread, the message will come from a service or a helper, so a SERVICE_MESSAGE is assumed. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
        Parameters:
        from - the calling class
        message -

      • logMessage

        public static void logMessage(java.lang.Object from,
                              int index,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              Agent serviceAgent,
                              Agent actingUser)
        Writes a log message. The given index (1-90) can be used to differentiate between different log messages. The serviceAgent and actingUser can be set to null if not known. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
        Parameters:
        from - the calling class
        index - an index between 1 and 90
        message -
        serviceAgent -
        actingUser -

      • logError

        public static void logError(java.lang.Object from,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Logs an error message to the l2p system using the observers. Since this method will/should only be used in an L2pThread, the message will come from a service or a helper, so a SERVICE_MESSAGE is assumed. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
        Parameters:
        from - the calling class
        message -

      • logError

        public static void logError(java.lang.Object from,
                            int index,
                            java.lang.String message,
                            Agent serviceAgent,
                            Agent actingUser)
        Writes an error message. The given index (1-90) can be used to differentiate between different log messages. The serviceAgent and userAgent can be set to null if not known. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
        Parameters:
        from - the calling class
        index - an index between 1 and 90
        message -
        serviceAgent -
        actingUser -
